text: Delivery of precast elements matches approved drawings and layout
Lifting inserts/hooks secured; lifting per manufacturer instructions
No damage during transport (chipping, cracking, surface blemishes)
Elements stored on level surfaces with adequate supports
Element type, orientation, and location verified prior to placement
Alignment and leveling within tolerance (horizontal & vertical)
Embedded items (anchors, sleeves, connections) properly aligned
Temporary bracing/shoring provided as per design until grouting
Joint gaps grouted using approved non-shrink grout or filler
Grout cured as per spec and finishing matches adjacent concrete surface
All connections and weld plates inspected and recorded
Subgrade compacted and proof-rolled, free from water, debris, or frost
Base layer (gravel/sand) thickness and leveling verified
Vapour barrier and insulation installed as per specification
Welded wire mesh or rebar installed as per drawing and supported on chairs
Control joint layout reviewed and marked prior to placement
Concrete placed uniformly; no cold joints or segregation
Vibrated/consolidated appropriately for slab type and thickness
Surface finish meets project requirements (broom, trowel, polished, etc.)
Joints saw-cut within time window to prevent cracking
Curing method implemented immediately after finishing
Final elevation and slope verified for drainage

id: • CSA A23.4 – Precast Concrete – Materials and Construction
• ACI 301 / 302 – Specifications for Concrete Construction / Flatwork Finishing
